Reminder → We will be distributing the Food Supplemental Boxes from Riverbend Food Bank the next three Fridays (September 4, 11, & 18) at John Deere Middle School parking lot from 10:30 am- 12:30 pm, or while supplies last. Moline Coal Valley School District has been recognized by the Illinois State Board of Education (ISBE) Latino Policy Forum for our work in English Language Learner Programming. We are featured on page 78 of the Illinois English Language Learner Handbook that was released statewide! A big shout out to Stephanee Jordan, our Director for Grants and Curricular Support, for her work as an editor of the EL Learner Handbook and for her work with the English Learner program.

Stephanee has served the district for 29 years as an educator and administrator. She served on the Bilingual Advisory Council for twelve years, a position that was appointed by the Illinois Governor. Stephanee was the first certified bilingual teacher at Moline High School. She also coordinated our grab & go meal distribution this past spring and the supplemental food program over the summer. Stephanee will be retiring at the end of the day today. We are grateful for her service to the district and years of dedication to our EL students! Thank you Stephanee! (photos from previous school year) #molinepride

The good health of your children and our students is always our priority but never more so than during this current pandemic. Please remember to check with your child’s health care provider in regards to maintaining well visit check-ups. As a reminder, per Illinois School Code, if you have a student entering Kindergarten, they need both a physical and an eye exam to start the year. Students entering 6th and 9th grades need a physical as well. A sports physical is needed for anyone participating in sports during the year. In addition, incoming 12th graders may need an updated meningitis vaccination. All forms and more detailed information can be found on the district website:

Although we could not recognize these four deserving winners in person, they were each recognized during a virtual staff meeting with their co-workers. Winners will receive a certificate, crystal globe paperweight, and a Jersey Mike's gift card. Special thanks to Jersey Mike's Subs for providing lunch certificates for the winners.

Over 200 nominations from all district schools were received for the third "Why Moline" staff award. The winners were nominated by their peers multiple times!

Ryan Rosenthal, PE Teacher, Hamilton/Bicentennial
Juli Smith, Social Worker, Jefferson/Hamilton
Zahra Suss, Teacher, Moline High School
Teresa Wise, Administrative Assistant, Jefferson

Congratulations and thank you for making a world of difference! #molinepride

THROW BACK THURSDAY → Timothy Polley, 1982 Moline alumni, shared a fun photo from the past in honor of Teacher Appreciation Week. This 1971 photo is from Garfield Elementary, with his favorite teacher, Mrs. Worrill, who had a lasting influence on him. Tim writes, “This lovely lady would not let me fail, and I read today because of her.”

Tim is now a minister in Kentucky. He had the honor of leading the opening invocation for the Kentucky House of Representatives in January. His wife, Lynne, (an alumni and teacher) is the daughter of former John Deere Middle School teacher, Don Dawson. Their two sons also attended Moline schools. The Polley’s are grateful for their Moline education.

Teachers touch our lives in so many ways. Thank you, Tim, for sharing this memory.
#molinepride #maroonfamily #ThankATeacher

Congratulations to MHS Senior Joe Lobb, who has been accepted as one of the high school soloists for the Honors Recital at the 42nd Navy Band International Saxophone Symposium in Fairfax, Virginia. The performance will be held on Saturday, January 11th at the Harris Theater.

This is a great honor as the Symposium only accepts ten or fewer high school saxophonists internationally! Joe is also a two-year All-State Musician.

Since a high-quality recording is necessary for these auditions, Joe utilized the built-in recording systems of the Instrumental Room that were part of the Bartlett Performing Arts Center's construction. While this function has been used many times for rehearsal purposes, this is the first example of a "real-world use" that this built-in amenity provides district students and the community! #molinepride

Moline High School students cut the ribbon during an open house to celebrate the high school's new CNC (Computer Numerical Control) manufacturing apprenticeship program earlier this evening. District staff, advisory board members, apprenticeship partners, and donors joined together to tour the new CNC lab featuring state-of-the-art lathes, vertical mills and FANUC simulator stations. Moline's CNC Manufacturing program is the only program of its kind in the Illinois Quad Cities!

The program creates an opportunity for students to earn as they learn, gain certification and college credit and invest their time in hands-on education and industry training that will prepare them for a bright future in our community.
#molinepride
